item.description:
City Love: How We Can All Achieve a Better Bottom Line by Loving our Cities

 

Cities represent the largest percentage of our population base and are critical to the local economy. What happens when your employees are delivering negative messages about our cities through your customer service experience? Katie Stebbins will present City Love: How We Can All Achieve a Better Bottom Line by Loving our Cities. Katie will present examples of messages that could be hurting your business and ways you can capture new customers by embracing the potential of our urban communities. Please join us for a lively discussion on why our cities matter.

 

Bio: Katie Stebbins is a freelance project management consultant specializing in city planning, economic development and non-profit project design and implementation. Her business, "Your Friend in Springfield" recently presented "Idea Mill" in Holyoke and will shortly launch "BYO Family", a family magazine for Springfield and the metro region. Katie is a former principal planner in Springfield and is currently chair of the Springfield Planning Board.
item.name: March Breakfast Meeting- Acheiving a Better Bottom Line by Loving our Cities
